title: Gamification Strategy Design to Enhance Engagement and Prevent Dropout in Science MOOCs

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level expertise in the scientific field, extensive practical experience, and proficiency in basic experimental design and data analysis
context.additional_context: Project-based learning for science practitioners to enhance scientific inquiry competencies. Requires gamification strategies optimized for personal device usage. Emphasizes hypothesis formulation, variable control, and data measurement/analysis activities

learning_goals: Learners complete ≥80% of weekly learning activities in scientific inquiry using gamification elements (experiment badges/analysis rewards) at each project stage
Peer evaluations (experiment result sharing/feedback) linked to reward systems increase learner interaction frequency by ≥30%

Within one week, learners earn ≥100 virtual points, converting them to educational resources (1 elective science experiment material or 30 minutes of expert mentoring) with ≥80% participation. They achieve ≥4 points on pre-post motivation surveys (5-point scale)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
